metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32189 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A too-short encoded message can cause a panic in Float.GobDecode and RatGobDecode in math/big in Go before 1.17.13 and 1.18.5, potentially allowinga denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.8 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.9 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.10 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.13 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.16 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.18 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4').
